name: impetuosity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] the quality or fact of doing things suddenly, without considering the results of your actions: She'd warned him against hasty decisions and impetuosity. The 18-year-old has great athleticism but also the impetuosity of youth. Synonym
impetuousness
[ C ] something you do suddenly, without considering the results of your actions: It is a telling story and it certainly exemplifies his impetuosities.
More examplesFewer examplesHe has little political experience and a record of impetuosity that may land him in trouble.Her impetuosity at the start cost her a 10-second penalty.The two young men set out on an adventure with optimism and impetuosity.
